alert.note: Alert for Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 12:57PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Washington County through 1230 PM CDT... At 1156 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Vernon. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Bradford, Live Oak, Wausau, Ebro, Brock Crossroad, Orange Hill, Whitehead Crossroads, Greenhead, Red Head, Holmes Valley, Millers Ferry, Gilberts Mill, Five Points, Porter Lake, Smyrna, Spring Hollow, Sunny Hills, Poplar Head and Sylvania. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
